subject: How to use exclude include w/ javadoc?
msgSnippet: I would like to ONLY include subdirectories that contain a src folder when generating javadocs but cannot figure out how to do this. I have tried to use the
messageBody:
I would like to ONLY include subdirectories that contain a 'src'
folder when generating javadocs but cannot figure out how to do this.

I have tried to use the fileset along with the include command but it
does not do what I was hoping for. Here are snippets from my
build.xml file of what I have tried:

=============================
<target name="dist" depends="init">
<javadoc sourcepath="${myNewPath}"
</target>

....bla bla ....
<target name="init" depends="init">
<property name="srcpath" value="\\bla\myServer"/>
<path id="use.this.path">
<fileset dir="${srcpath}">
<include name="**/src" />
</fileset>
</path>
<property name="myNewPath" refid="use.this.path"/>
</target>
==============================

Any help is greatly appreciated....thanks!
